intro: Eriocarpum serratum, commonly known as the serrated eriocarpum, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and distinctive, serrated fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture, while its fruits are small, dry, and covered in a fine, hairy coating. Eriocarpum serratum is well adapted to arid environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
